Several hostages were taken by the attackers, who numbered three. Causality figures vary, between 12 and 18, which included the death of the Somali ambassador to Switzerland. Later reports confirm the total dead numbered 14. Several more wounded. By the end of the siege military forces had regained control of the hotel.

Fresh clan clash broke out between Hawadle and Dir/Faqa Omar Faqa Mohumed in Deefow village (29km NW Beled Weyne) in the morning of 27/03.   Hawadle militias on their side claimed that their opponent were supported by Ethiopian Lieu police who control the area. Exact casualties cannot be ascertained since communication was switched off, however five hawadle militias were injured and brought to Beled Weyne hospital where one of the victims succumbed to his injuries.
An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to Jubaland forces in Via Afmadow in Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 2703. The vehicle was damaged but no human casualties were reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Jubaland and AMISOM-Kenya forces oust al Shabaab forces from Yoontoy Yarey following a fighting on 27/03. Causalities not known.

An al Shabaab attack on Maka Al-Mukarramah Hotel and subsequent battle with SNG forces begins at 4pm on 27/03 and lasts through the following morning. Several hostages were taken by the attackers, who numbered three. Causality figures vary, between 12 and 18, which included the death of the Somali ambassador to Switzerland. Later reports indicate the total dead numbered 14. Several more wounded. By the end of the siege military forces had regained control of the hotel.

Jubaland security forces on a mission to disarm all police officers who left their bases without authorization shot and killed a civilian in Argo neighbourhood in the evening of 28/03. The reason behind the incident is currently unknown. No arrest was reported regarding the incident.

A group of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire with suspected al Shabaab fighters who were allegedly trying to kill one of the SNG soldiers in Doonka Weynow (12km N of Afgooye) in the morning of 28/03. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in near the seaport (Marka) in the night of 28/03. The fighting lasted for about half an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Mushaani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 28/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante/Hassan Ugas sub-clan reportedly carjacked a track and abducted three men from Hawiye/Hawaadle sub-clan who were on board at the time in the vicinity of Bali-Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 28/03. The motive of the attack is currently unclear but it's believed to be related to a previous incident where gunmen from Hawiye carjacked a Dhulbahante track in Beled-Weyne area following a dispute over business. Reports indicate that Somaliland police in support of local Dhulbahante elders reportedly rescue the three men and their track and brought to Laas Caanood police station.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 29/03. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Buulo Jan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 29/03. The device reportedly hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. AMISOM forces opened gunfire indiscriminately in response to the attack. The AMISOM forces later conducted a security operation, arrested five armed militiamen and seized a number of explosives devices. The militiamen (Biimaal) were later released after SWIA ministers requested AMISOM forces to release them. Both AMISOM and civilian casualties were confirmed but the exact figures are currently unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces base in Abdi Wayel neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 30/03. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers detonated an RCIED at NISA forces manning a security checkpoint at Dabka junction (Waaberi District) in the morning of 30/03. One NISA soldier was reportedly injured. The perpetrators escaped.

SNG soldiers manning a checkpoint at Ex-control Afgooye (Hodan District) opened gunfire at a mini-bus carrying civilian passengers in the evening of 03/04. The motive is unclear. One passenger was killed in the shooting.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a civilian man and his wife in their home in Boqoleey section of Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 30/03. The motive behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

An IED targeted a check-point (a tax collection point) in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 30/03. The target was said to be SNG forces manning the checkpoint. Two civilians were injured by the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland Intelligence base in Gulwade section of Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the early morning of 30/03. No casualties were reported from Jubaland forces side while local residents reported one al Shabaab injured.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces' based in Kudhaa village (53km E of Badhaadhe) in the early morning of 30/03. No casualties were reported.

Residents in Wadamogo (18km E of Caynabo) held a peaceful demonstration that was attended by elders and residents mainly women, to show their full support to the decision made by Habar Jeclo elders to end the dialogue between Dhulbahante and Habar Jeclo. The elders noted through the media that the Dhulbahante have tied the talks with the conditional release of Jama Kutiyee, a Dhulbahante man who is currently being held in Somaliland prison after he was reportedly convicted of terrorism charges.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 31/03. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew.  Casualties could not be established.

SNG/ASWJ clashed with al Shabaab fighters in an area south of Buurdhuubo (35km SE of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 31/03. The clashes broke out after both sides arrived in the area to solve a dispute over land ownership between two farmers. Two soldiers from SNG/ASWJ sides suffered minor injuries.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces checkpoint in the outskirt of Afgooye in the evening of 31/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 31/03. AMISOM fighters opened gunfire after the blast. Casualties are unknown.

Gunmen from Habar-Jeclo reportedly shot and killed a man hailing from Dhulbahante/Khalid sub-clan in Balli Cadaad near Xadhaadhanka Village (155km SE of Burco) in the evening of 31/03. The motive behind the killing remains unknown but is believed to be related to the recent armed clashes between the two warring clans in the area of Meygaagle village (26km N of Buuhoodle). The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' base near Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 01/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces conducting security operations on industrial road opened gunfire at a University Bus carrying students heading to Somali University in Hawl-Wadaag District in the morning of 01/04/2015. The driver was killed and a civilian female bystander was injured in the shooting. Reports show that the forces suspected the Bus and opened gunfire at it. SNG forces have arrested the shooter.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a woman in the vicinity of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 01/04. The motive is currently unknown.

A group of al Shabaab operatives reportedly exchanged fire for a short while with Puntland forces manning the southern check point of Bossaso in the evening of the 01/04.  Two people were reportedly injured in the shootout.

A civilian man was abducted from his home in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) by unidentified people in the morning of 01/04. His decapitated body was found in the same morning at the new livestock market area in Isha neighbourhood. The motive is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

A peaceful demonstration was staged in Dhusamareeb attended by the public to voice their support for the Central State building conference to be held in Dhusamareeb in the afternoon of 01/04. No insecurity incident was reported. Reports indicate that Somalia president has postponed his planned visit to Dhusamareeb.

A SNG soldier (Xawadle) was shot and injured by unidentified perpetrators in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 01/04. The motive is unknown but could be related to clan revenge. The assailants escaped.

Pro self-declared Westland state militias hailing from Jejele sub-clan shot and killed two men they claimed were al Shabaab members in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood of Beled Weyne in the evening of 01/04.  The militia reportedly said that the men had confessed to be al Shabaab members, although this could not be verified independently.

SNG forces conducting a security operation outside Buulo Burte clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Jameeco Mubaarak (21km SE of Buulo Burte) in the morning of 01/04. There are conflicting casualties of al Shabaab fighters. Villagers reported that bodies of al Shabaab fighters were put on the streets for the public to view. Numbers not known.

Al Shabaab ambushed Jubaland forces traveling in a private Mini-bus in Yoontoy Yare Village (25km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 01/04. The forces were heading to Buulo Gaduud when  the incident happened. One Jubaland soldier was killed.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Jubaland forces on patrol discovered an IED in Aargo section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 01/04. The IED was safely detonated.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a check-point manned by SNG forces in Bariirre Village (26km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 01/04. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a local tax collector in Dhagax-Tuur neighbourhood in Afgooye in the afternoon of 01/04. No casualties were reported.

A brief armed clash reportedly erupted between herders from Habar Jeclo/Sool Madow and Dhulbahante/Ahmed Garad sub-clans near Kalshaale Village (40km NE of Buuhoodle) on 01/04. The fighting follows the recent fresh tensions between the two sides following the killings of Dhulbahante man near Xadhaadhanka Village on 31/03. One combatant from Dhulbahante/Ahmed Garad sub-clan was injured in the clash.

A driver of an INGO rented vehicle was shot and injured in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood on 02/04. The victim was transferred to Guri Ceel hospital for surgery. The incident is said to be related to clan revenge.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a woman's residence in Siliga in Berdaale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the early morning of 03/04 after no one had showed up to open the door. The gunmen killed the woman together with her daughter. The reason for the killing is unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate the woman was a cook for the SWIA Security Minister. Another woman was shot and killed at the same time in the same neighbourhood by other unknown gunmen. The victim was said to be the chairperson for the neighbourhood's watch team. The perpetrators escaped and no arrest was made.

A SNG soldier shot and killed his colleague at the MIA Civilian Gate (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 04/04 following a dispute over unknown reasons. Other SNG soldiers in the area arrested the perpetrator.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed a SNG military officer at Former US Embassy Building area (Wadajir District) in the evening of 04/04. The reason for the killing is unclear and the perpetrators escaped.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Lami yaraha neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the midday of 04/04. The reason for the killing is unknown and the perpetrator escaped.

A hand grenade thrown by suspected al Shabaab operatives, targeting the house of Jubaland police commissioner landed in a nearby civilian residence and injured a mother and her two daughters in Siinay section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 04/04. The injured civilians were taken to Kismaayo hospital for treatments. No arrests were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Sheikh Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 04/04. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. One civilian bystander was reportedly injured in the shooting.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' base in Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 05/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after that al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a vehicle belonging to Waaberi DC near Waaberi Police station (Waaberi District) in the evening of 05/04.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Galbeed Police Station in Dharkeynley District in the evening of 05/04. The grenade exploded without causing casualties. The attackers managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Puntland forces manning a check point near Karama 1 Hotel in Bosasso in the evening of the 05/04. The two sides exchanged gun fire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Three soldiers reported wounded.

Unidentified gunmen shot and injured the DC of Carmo and his sister in Carmo (205km S of Bosasso) in the evening of 05/04. The DC's body guard was killed in the attack. The motive of the attack is unknown but it is believed that the attackers were al Shabaab elements. The incident happened in the residence of the DC.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire at civilians in Gadoon Village (22km SE of Godinlabe), killing at least 3 people in the morning of 05/04. The motive of the attack is said to be clan revenge between within Habar Gidir/Ayr/Absiye sub-clans.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan war planes reportedly destroyed two al Shabaab positions Gaadondhowe Village (40km SE of Beled Xawo) on 05/04 in response to the Garissa University massacre. The destruction of the camps could not be independently confirmed. Al Shabaab later denied their destruction.

A Somaliland army officer from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan killed his colleague and injured another in a Somaliland army base in Gambadha Village (28km E of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 05/04 following an escalated dispute. The victims hail from Habar Yonis/Cali Siciid. The perpetrator was arrested and transferred to Burco.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG soldiers manning a checkpoint at Florence Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 06/04. No casualties were reported and the attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' outpost at the former Eimiska building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 06/04. Two sides exchanged gunfire briefly but no casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters also carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' base at the former Pasta Factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 06/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly but casualties could not be established.

An unidentified gunman shot and killed an elderly man in Afarta Darjiino Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 06/04. The reason for the killing is unknown. The victim had been involved in a land dispute with another person and the regional court ruled in his favour recently. The perpetrator escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' base in Al-Baraka neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 06/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two people (civilians) in Al-Baraka neighbourhood in Hodan District in the evening of 06/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

Armed men from Rer Mahad and Rer Qalaf (who are both Umar Mohamud-Majerteen Clan) clashed  over the ownership of a parcel of land in an area close to Warshad Kaabka in Galkacyo north on 06/04. One combatant was killed and two others injured. Puntland police intervened and managed to disperse the two sides.

Two INGO staff members were stabbed and injured by a civilian man using a dagger over alleged land dispute in Garowe in the morning of 06/04. No arrests were made in connection with the incident but the police are searching the perpetrator.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceel-Afweyn court on 06/04 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against local youths. The demonstrators were mostly parents of the detained youths from Habar-Jeclo/Biciide sub-clan and Habar-Yunis/Sacad Yonis sub-clan following clashes between rival youth gangs.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Baar Ismail checkpoint (Afgooye) in the morning of 06/04. AMISOM forces opened gunfire after the blast. Another IED was found near the scene of the blast and was later disabled.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed an assistant engineer working as a third party contractor for a UN agency and injured his driver in Xamar Bile neighbourhood (Wardhiigleey District) in the morning of 07/04. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack on 08/04. The only justification given by al Shabaab for the attack was the fact that the victim was a member of Banadir regional administration.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' position in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 07/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: On 7 April, [al Shabaab] forces in Galgaduud region heavily attacked bases belonging to Ethiopian forces in Ceelbuur town. Reports say that [al Shabaab] inflicted heavy casualties (numbers not known) on the enemy forces. Radio Andalus is pro al Shabaab.

Jubaland forces launched a hit-and-run attack against al Shabaab fighters in Turqata Village (20km W of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 07/04. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. Jubaland forces seized two AK 47 rifles belonging to the two al Shabaab fighters.

Jubaland Darawish forces staged a peacefully demonstration in protest over salary non-increment in Kismaayo in the morning of 07/04. The Darawish forces have been demanding increment since the beginning of this year. The soldiers refused to collect their March salary.

An IED targeted the second deputy governor of Mudug Region, Ahmed Muse Nuur, behind Galkacyo Hospital in Galkacyo North in the morning of 07/04. His body guards opened fire after the blast. The deputy governor and seven others were injured in the explosion. There was a second explosion that seemingly targeted curious residents who milled around the incident scene. One person was injured in the second blast. The perpetrators managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED supposedly targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded in the vicinity of Ceel Saliini Village (32km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 07/04 and missed the target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

A gunman from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub-clan near Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 07/04 after suspecting the man of being on spying mission. However, reports indicate that the victim was mentally ill. The perpetrator escaped. The killing caused tension between Habar Jeclo and Dhulbahante sub-clans in area with both sub-clans mobilizing their militias. The murder comes at a time when there were ongoing talks between the two sub-clans with a view of ending the sporadic revenge killings between the two sides.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 08/04. The fighting lasted for almost fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a woman in Billaajo Carab neighbourhood (Shibis District) in the afternoon of 08/04. The victim was reportedly working with the local district administration. The perpetrators escaped.  Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Garasbaaley (Hodan District) in the evening of 08/04. The RCIED hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. AMISOM forces opened gunfire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrator(s) escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 08/04. The perpetrators escaped.

A Dhulbahante armed group loyal to Mohamed Farah Aden, the former Puntland minister of fisheries, who recruited locals and mining experts to explore minerals exchanged gunfire with Somaliland forces in a mountain near Carro Weyne village (45km NE of Buuhoodle) on 08/04. The former minister and his team refused to surrender to Somaliland forces who were attempting to stop the exploration activities. The former minister and four of his team were arrested while a man from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub-clan was injured and later succumbed to his injuries in Laas Caanood. Local elders have stepped to try to secure the release of the former minister.

Somaliland troops based in Widh Widh (48km NE of Buuhoodle) exchanged gunfire with former Puntland minister of fisheries in accompany of armed men. The forces later managed to arrest the Ex-minister and three of his men on 08/04.

A SNG soldier opened gunfire at a mini-bus at Ex-Control Afgooye in the afternoon of 09/04, killing one passenger (male) in the afternoon of 09/04. The reason for the shooting remains unclear and the perpetrator was arrested by SNG forces in the area but was released later.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded two elders (between 80 and 90 years-old) from of Rahaweyn/Luweys sub-clans in Hunyaley Village (13km E Xudur) in the night of 11/04. The al Shabaab executed the elders after accusing them of working with the apostate administration (referring to ISWA administration in Xudur).
A local journalist working for Radio Mogadishu Website was shot and injured by unidentified men armed with pistols near KPP Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 10/04.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' outpost in the vicinity of Mahad Alle Car Wash in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 11/04. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties numbered two (Alldhacdo).
Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed two SNG Mogadishu municipality tax policemen in Suuq Bacaad Market (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 11/04 and escaped.

At least six mortars fired from unknown location targeting the former Defence Ministry landed near the former Guulwadayasha base and the Ministry in Dayniile District in the evening of 11/04. Initial reports indicate that three civilians were killed and seven others wounded in Guulwadayasha neighbourhood in the mortar attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces attacked al Shabaab fighters near Wareer Maleh Village (39km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 11/04. One al Shabaab fighter was killed in the clash. The AMISOM forces seized nine sets of SNG army uniforms.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two RCIED explosions took place at Dayniile Junction in the vicinity of the former Jaale Siyad Military Academy (Dayniile District) in the morning of 12/04. The explosions happened just after a AMISOM/SNG military convoy guarding the SNG president passed the area. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The president was travelling to Dayniile to attend a ceremony marking the 55th anniversary of Somali army at the former Defence Ministry.

At least four Mortar rounds fired from unknown location landed inside the ministry of defence compound (Dayniile District) in the morning of 12/04. A ceremony to mark the Somali National Army Day Anniversary was taking place in the Compound when the mortar rounds landed. No casualties were reported. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack through Somalimemo.net.
Al Shabaab fighters attack residence of the District Commissioner of Beled Xawo (12/04). Further details of the attack not known.

A Somaliland soldier from Warsangeli/Reer garad Sub-clan shot and killed his commander from Warsangeli/Dubays in Ceel-Buh Village (112km SE of Ceerigaabo) in the morning of 12/04 following a dispute of the soldier's salary payment. The soldier was immediately arrested by other Somaliland soldiers.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a hotel in Qoryooley town where the governor of Lower Shabelle had been staying in the night of 12/04. The guards of the governor engaged in a 30-minute shoot-out with the attackers. One of the governor's guards was killed and four others wounded in the fighting. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in S. Company Building (Heliwa District) in the evening of 13/04. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One SNG soldier was reportedly killed in the clash while three others were injured.

Security guards for the Public works and housing deputy Minister of ISWA (Interim South West Administration) shot and killed a civilian man (a wheelbarrow porter) in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 13/04. The reason for the killing remains unknown and no arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces at a checkpoint in Cumar Beere (9km NW of Marka) in the night of 13/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED exploded in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow village (11km NE of Marka) in the morning of 13/04. An AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu was passing the road when the incident happened. No casualties or vehicle damages were reported.

Four suspected al Shabaab fighters dressed in SNG forces uniform carried out a complex attack on the Ministry of Culture and Higher Education compound near Zobe Junction (Hodan District) on 14/04. There was a suspected SVBIED explosion at the gate followed by armed men storming the building. The attackers threw hand grenades and exchanged gunfire with SNG police guarding the compound. NISA's Gaashan unit and AMISOM forces immediately arrived at the scene and engaged in gun battles with the attackers. Initial reports indicate that about 11 people, including two police officers and the attackers, have been killed. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack. Among the injured was a Chinese diplomat. Later reports hold a total of 21 dead; six security operatives and 15 civilians (Xinhua).

Puntland forces and al Shabaab fighters reportedly clashed in Galgala village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the evening of 15/04. Reports indicate that the fighting was initiated by al fighters and lasted for around 45 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Xawadle militia exchange gunfire with security personnel at a private construction site of a sports stadium in Ceel Jaale neighbourhood in Beled Weyne on 14/04 following a land ownership dispute between the local authority and the Xawadle militia. Xawadle militia decided to stop the construction using by force. No casualties were reported but the construction is suspended until the problem is solved.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' checkpoint in War Mahan Village (30km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 14/04. Both groups engaged in a brief exchange of gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against NISA base in Sarta Qabyada building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 15/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against NISA base in Sarta Qabyada building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 15/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Ceelasha Biyaaha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 15/04. Casualties are unknown.

Reports from Cadaado town, the HQ of the Ximin and Xeeb state, say large protests are going on there against plans to have Dhuusamareeb the [new] capital of the central regions. The protests are ongoing at the Ximin and Xeeb presidential HQ with hundreds of angry people stoning the HQ building.

Militiamen hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a pastoralist hailing from Habar Gidir/Sa'ad sub-clan near Gamafole Village (55km NE of Galkacyo) in the evening of 16/04. The incident was reportedly in revenge for previous killings between the two sides.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Mahadaay (12km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 16/04. A girl was hit and injured by a stray bullet. No other casualties were reported.

Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against the Somaliland forces based in Kalabaydh Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 16/04. The Somaliland forces responded with artillery fire after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters and Puntland police manning Baalade police station in Bosasso clashed in the evening of 17/04. The fighting was initiated by the al Shabaab fighters who attacked the police station. The two sides exchanged fire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The station's deputy police commander was injured in the clash.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters and ENDF clashed near Korow-Rooge Village (15km SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 17/04. The fighting started after al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF military convoy travelling between Daynuunay Village and Baidoa town. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of the Jubaland's health minister in Waamo section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 17/04. The bomb landed in an open area, injuring one of the security guards of the minister. The attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' base in Siinka Dheer (Afgooye District) in the night of 17/04. The fighting went for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
SNG forces on security operation shot and killed an al Shabaab sympathizer in Qaydar Edi Village (27km NW of Xudur) in the afternoon of 18/04. The SNG forces later returned to their base in Xudur.
SNG forces arrested a suspected al Shabaab operative in Waajid in the afternoon of 18/04. The suspect managed to escape from the police during but was immediately shot dead before going far.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Sei-Biano neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 18/04. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified armed men in car shot and killed a Puntland state MP in front of his house in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the midday of 18/04. The reason for the shooting remains unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters picked a civilian a woman from her house in Goof Gaduud Village (30km NW of Baidoa) and beheaded her in the outskirt of the village in the night of 18/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear. The victim hails from Rahaweyn/Harin sub-clan.

An armed clash broke out between Duduble and Habar Iji at a water catchment in Lebi Dunle, near Dhaban dhulkuhayn area (about 26km N of Dhusamareeb) in the morning of 18/04, following a dispute over water catchment in the area. Three people were killed (I from Duduble and 2 from Habar Iji) and several others were wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM (KDF) contingent conducted attacked al Shabaab base in Gheldezza area (90km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 18/04. Reports indicate that 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed and their weapons seized. Three KDF soldiers were killed and seven others injured.

Biimaal militia ambushed two SNG soldiers riding on a motorbike near Gendawi (7km W of Marka) in the morning of 18/04. The two sides engaged in an armed clash before the SNG soldiers received reinforcement from Shalaambood and forced the attackers to withdraw. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. Two SNG soldiers were injured during the fight.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a taxi driver in his residence in Aymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 19/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/ENDF convoy in Gasarla (8km SE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 19/04. Reports indicate that the convoy was returning from Buur Hakaba when the ambush happened. The telecommunication network was switched off during the attack. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were injured. Injured AMISOM soldiers were evacuated to Baidoa.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM military convoy travelling between Leego (49km E of Buur Hakaba) and Bali-Doogle Airport (13km NW of Wanla Weyn) in the morning of 19/04. The ambush started with RCIED explosion followed by direct confrontation between the two sides. Two AMISOM soldiers were killed while 12 others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters opened fire using small guns towards new Kismaayo airport from north-eastern direction of the airport in the evening of 19/04. AMISOM/KDF responded by opening fire in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based near Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 19/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' outpost in Heliwa Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 20/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a rickshaw driver in Berdale neighbourhood in Baidoa in the night of 20/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of Beled Xawo District Commissioner in the evening of 20/04. The hand grenade exploded in an empty area. Security guards at the residence opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator managed to escape. This is the second time in a span of two weeks in which the DC's residence came under attack.
SNG forces on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Buq Goosaar (50km SW of Beled-weyne) in the morning of 20/4. One al Shabaab fighter was killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces' base in Afmadow in the night of 20/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. An 18-year-old girl was reportedly injured by a stray bullet. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established.

A IED targeted a UN agency mini-bus transporting staff between the UN International Guest House and the UN compound in Garowe along the tarmac road opposite Rugsan Hotel in the morning of 20/04. Preliminary information indicates that the attack was carried out by a suicide bomber on foot (PBIED). At least seven people were killed including four UN international staff while seven others, two in serious conditions. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Mushani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 20/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces' base in Rimaygacmeed (5km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 20/04. The fighting lasted for about twenty minutes before the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A VBIED targeted Banoda Restaurant, opposite Central Hotel in Boondheere District in the afternoon of 21/04.   About 12 people were killed and dozens others injured. The restaurant was frequented by Somali Government officials, security officers and the diaspora. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, saying that the restaurant is frequented by staff working at the presidential palace, other government staff and the diaspora.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' outpost in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 21/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters allegedly abducted a header near Afmadow in the afternoon of 21/04 while grazing his animals. Reports indicate that the man was taken to Bu'ale town in Middle Juba region (100km NE of Afmadow). The reason behind the abduction is currently unclear.

Two armed groups hailing from Leelkase and Majeerteen sub-clans exchanged gunfire in Halabookhad IDP camp in Galkacyo North in the evening of 21/04. The shooting reportedly started after the two groups had a dispute over the administering of the camp in Halabookhad. A civilian bystander (woman) was seriously injured by a stray bullet. The woman later succumbed to her injuries at a private hospital in Galkacyo. Puntland mobile police forces in Galkacyo reportedly arrived at the scene and arrested number of combatants from the two sides with the help of the area elders.

An armed clash broke out between the two sub-clans of Dhulbahante (Farah Ali and Samokaab Ali) in Taleex 21/04. The motive of the armed clash is believed to be related to killing revenges and the prolonged disputes between the two sides. Reports later on 21/04 indicate that four combatants were killed. Dhulbahante traditional elders arrived in Taleex to prevent further clashes and open reconciliation talks meeting between the two sides. Somaliland forces were also deployed in the town to also prevent further clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Cabdi Wayel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 22/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces, police and military clashed in Zona K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 22/04. The clash started when about 100 Police forces led by Banadir Region Governor reached Zona K neighbourhood to evict civilian families who were living in state-owned building in the neighbourhood which the military forces opposed.  Reports indicate that there were some casualties from both sides but the exact figure of the casualties could not be established. The police forces retreated back from the scene.

Unidentified gunmen driving in a vehicle exchanged gunfire with NISA forces in the vicinity of KM4 neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 22/04. Reports indicate that the NISA forces reportedly started the shooting after the gunmen denied security instructions. No casualties were reported.

Local media reported that a peaceful demonstration organized by Garbahaarey district administration in protest against the selection and distribution of local MPs in Kismaayo took place in Garbahaarey on 22/04. The demonstrators were shouting slogans against Jubaland Interim state. No insecurity incident was reported.
Al Shabaab infighting kills five and injures seven in Halgan and Garesiyaani areas of Hiiraan. The clash stemmed from money extorted from motorists.
Al Shabaab infighting kills five and injures seven in Halgan and Garesiyaani areas of Hiiraan. The clash stemmed from money extorted from motorists.
A senior military officer was shot dead in the Somali capital, al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility. The district within the capital is not known.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Jiiro Maskiin neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the morning of 23/04. The perpetrators escaped.

Heavily armed gunmen suspected to be members of Al-Shabaab on the morning of 23/04 kidnapped senior Arabia chief in Mandera County Kenya along the Mandera-Arabia road. The chief was driven across the border into Somalia where he was killed at Gadoon Dhowe, Beled Xawo District.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade against police pick-up in Buulo Mareer town (29km SW of Marka) in the morning of 23/04. The vehicle was reportedly carrying a newly appointed police commissioner for Buulo Mareer. The vehicle was damaged by the blast but no human casualties were reported. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two men in Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 23/04. The victims were reportedly working for Afgooye tax collection department. The perpetrators escaped.

SNG forces on a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Burdho village (27km NE of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 24/04. The fighting lasted for around 30 minutes and both sides used light and heavy weapons. One SNG soldier was seriously injured while two al Shabaab fighters have been killed and their guns were been confiscated.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: A group of al Shabaab fighters went to Qaydar Edi Village (27km NW of Xudur) on 24/04 and allegedly confiscated mobile phones and other valuables from the residents while reportedly setting on fire the fence of a water catchment. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters intimidated the villagers and forced them to move to Moro Gabey (28km SW of Xudur).
Al Shabaab authorities executed a man who allegedly abused Prophet Mohammed following after a court found him guilty. The execution was carried out in a public ground in Jamaame on 24/04.

Residents of Sinai neighbourhood (Hargeisa) held a peaceful demonstration on 24/04 in protest against arrest of one of their local religious leader. The arrested religious leader was accused of violence, inciting the public and criticizing the government of hosting so many foreigners in the country.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNG forces convoy in Abaq Beeday village (16km E of Xudur) along the main road between Xudur and Tayeeglow in the afternoon of 25/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties on both sides could not be established while AMISOM forces have so far not confirmed the ambush.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an SNG government official in Kor-Damac neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 25/04. The victim was a chairperson of a neighbourhood in Dayniile District and the reason for the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an SNG government official in Israac neighbourhood (Xamar jajab District) in the evening of 25/04.  The reason behind the killing remains unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a former SNG MP hailing from Rahanweyn/Gelidle sub-clan in Abdalla Shideeye section in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 25/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces based in Ceel Buur in the night of 25/04. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for around 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not been established.

Unidentified attacker(s) shot and killed a member of council of elders from Jejele clan in front of his house in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the night of 25/04. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Moalim Nur neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) over dispute of manning of a checkpoint in the evening of 26/04. One soldier was killed and three others were injured.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in KPP neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 26/04. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear while the assailants escaped.

A group of gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab fighters stopped a mini-bus transporting goats from Maxaas to Buulo Burte in Abooreey (22km NE of Buulo Burte) in the night of 26/04 and abducted the owner and taking to unknown destination.

Unidentified gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab operatives shot and killed two body guards of newly nominated Jubaland MP in Via-Afmadow in Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 26/04. The motive behind the killing remained unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the outskirt of Afgooye in the night of 26/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a while after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' outpost in the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 27/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in Cumar-Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 27/04. The two groups exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in the outskirts of Bariirre Village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 27/04.  Reports indicate that the al Shabaab attackers took over the check-point but withdrew shortly thereafter Casualties could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA post in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 28/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about five minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Puntland police forces manning at the first check point of Bosasso port in the night of 29/04. A bystander businessman was killed by the blast while two women were injured. The perpetrators escaped. No arrests were made in connection with incident.

Puntland forces and al Shabaab/Galgala fighters clashed in Galgala mountain (35km SW of Bossaso) in the morning of 28/04. The clash started after Puntland forces advanced towards al Shabaab/Galgala fighter's position in Galgala mountains. Casualties could not be established.

Puntland forces based in Balli khayr (48km SW of Bossaso) went on strike over unpaid salaries on 28/04. Reports suggest that the soldiers erected a checkpoint in Laag Village (27km S of Bossaso) and started to extort money from the public transportation. There are ongoing negotiations between the forces and the government officials on how to end the strike.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces base in the outskirts of Janaale (13km NW of Marka) in the evening of 28/04. The exchange of gunfire lasted for a few minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM (KDF) convoy in Gosay area - a grazing land - (38km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 28/04. An AMISOM (KDF) truck was damaged at the rear part by the blast. The forces open fire after the explosion. No casualties were reported both the explosion and the subsequent shooting.

An IED targeted a vehicle driven by a staff of an INGO near Radio Galkacyo in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the morning of 28/04. The device seems to be planted inside the vehicle before it exploded. The staff escaped unhurt but the blast injured three women passerby and seriously damaged the vehicle. No arrests were made in connection with the incident.

Unidentified men armed with AK47 shot and killed a local radio (Radio Baidoa) reporter and his wife near Unay junction in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 30/04. The victims' were in their house when the incident happened while a third person (a neighbour) who came out of his house following the gunshot was also killed. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces in Janaale (13km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 30/04. The forces opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Mareerey Village (roughly 5km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 30/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No Casualties were reported.
In December 2014, a hand grenade killed 3 children in Ajak Kuac Payam, Warrap State. Reports suggest that the grenade was left an unexploded ordinance.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLM-IO reportedly recruiting in Western Bahr el Ghazal.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba has said that rebel forces have been shelling Nasir and SPLA-Juba positions from Dec.31-Jan.3.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: A spokesman for SPLA-Juba forces said that SPLA-IO forces shelled their position near the Unity oil fields in the morning.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA-IO and SPLA-Juba forces clashed near the Unity oil fields, north of Bentiu. An SPLA-Juba spokesman said that rebel forces attacked their position. 2 SPLA-Juba soldiers were killed in the attack.
Director of security services in Mundri West was shot dead in Mundri in early January.
A cattle thief was killed during clashes with a joint security force along the Tore-Maridi border.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: The SPLA-IO reportedly attacked SPLA-Juba forces on the southwest side of Bentiu. The attack was repulsed. The SPLA-IO claims it lost more than 20 soldiers with 30 wounded, while claiming that they inflicted heavy losses on the government (coded as 10).

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: The SPLA-IO claims that they clashed with SPLA-Juba forces on the Guit and Nhialdiu roads near Bentiu.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: The SPLA-IO claims that they clashed with SPLA-Juba forces on the Guit and Nhialdiu roads near Bentiu.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei
NOTES: A Sudanese driver working for the UNISFA was kidnapped by unidentified armed men.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes were reported in and about Nasir between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
SOURCE: Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Sudan Tribune
NOTES: Clashes were reported in Maban between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces Jan.8-9. An SPLA-IO spokesman said they torched an SPLM-N military training centre in the area before clashing with the SPLA-Juba and inflicted heavy casualties, as well as injuring at least 1 officer, before pulling out of the area. 2 SPLA-IO fighterss sustained minor injuries. 5 civilians were also reportedly killed during the attack by SPLA-IO forces, and at least 4 young women were abducted. An SPLA-IO spokesman denied the abductions.

A former Unity state official has claimed he survived an assassination attempt for his critical views by security forces personnel acting on the orders of the Unity state governor. The men ransacked the former officials residence and kidnapped him to the bush where he was able to escape.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
SOURCE: Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Sudan Tribune
NOTES: Clashes were reported in Maban between SPLA-Juba and SPLA-IO forces Jan.8-9. An SPLA-IO spokesman said they torched an SPLM-N military training centre in the area before clashing with the SPLA-Juba and inflicted heavy casualties, as well as injuring at least 1 officer, before pulling out of the area. 2 SPLA-IO fighterss sustained minor injuries. 5 civilians were also reportedly killed during the attack by SPLA-IO forces, and at least 4 young women were abducted. An SPLA-IO spokesman denied the abductions.

The caretaker governor of Lakes state was ambushed by unidentified gunmen who fired on his convoy. His bodyguards fought them off using weapons seized by the attackers. 1 of the attackers was taken captive, and no casualties were reported.

8 people were killed in a revenge attack by Pagoor youth on Tieptiep payam in Cueibet county, allegedly due to the release of a Tieptiep clan member who killed one of the Pagoor community. 2 others were injured, including the paramount chief.

Youth from Rajaf Payam, near Juba, armed with traditional weapons clashed with SPLA-Juba soldiers whom they accused of selling off community land in the area, resulting in youth wounded. The officer who wounded the youth has been detained by police.
Bor county commissioner claimed that Murle tribesmen raided Pawuoi cattle camp in Nyuak Payam of East Twic County, killing 2 and wounding others in the attack.
1 woman was shot and wounded, and died on her way to hospital, after unidentified gunmen attacked her and her friends while they were collecting firewood outside of Chukudum town.
Armed gunmen attacked a village near the Lakes State Legislative Assembly, 1km outside Rumbek town. 1 person was killed and 3 were injured, 1 seriously. Some of the attackers wore police uniforms.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: HRW reported a January spike in incidents of child soldier recruitment in and around Malakal by both rebel and military forces (especially those led by former militia leader Johnson Olony).

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked Gendrasa in Maban County in January. 4 women and girls abducted.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: A peace conference has started in Mundri to resolve disputes between pastoralists and local farmers in the area following clashes which began in October 2014.

At least one SPLA soldier was killed and another one wounded in a shooting targeting two SPLA vehicles on the road between Raja and Boro Medina in Western Bahr el Ghazal State. LRA accused of the attack.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: In early January, 30 Nuer soldiers deserted from the military forces at Boro Medina and Raga town.
4 fishermen killed in Dolo area (coordinates unavailable), Raja county.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: A major attack has been reported by SPLA-IO forces against SPLA-Juba position in Umdhurich, northeast of Renk. No casualty figures have yet been reported.
Culture, Youth, and Sports Minister Gatluak Liephoth Dieu was attacked and beaten in the UN base on Jan. 17. Gatluak's bodyguard and a woman who tried to disperse the fight were also hurt.
At least 11 civilians killed over 3 days (Jan 18-20) of attacks and cattle raids on the Bari village of Kworiji-Luri, north of Juba.  Attack allegedly carried out by 50 members of the Mundari tribe.
Unknown gunmen in three vehicles pulled up to the Motherland Hotel in Nimule Payam in Eastern Equatoria state and opened fire, killing 2 members of the Madi ethnic group.

ACTOR2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Rebels loyal to Machar clashed with military forces in the Maper area of Rumbek. County headquarters was attacked, several homes burned.  At least 10 civilians killed and 24 wounded.

ACTOR2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA-IO and Gai Gatluak accuse government forces in Renk of shelling in Bushar, Musekbel, Gabat and Dongos. Rebels claim to have pushed government forces back to their positions.
At least 11 civilians killed over 3 days (Jan 18-20) of attacks and cattle raids on the Bari village of Kworiji-Luri, north of Juba.  Attack allegedly carried out by 50 members of the Mundari tribe.
At least 7 people killed following an attack on Mantio village, allegedly carried out by fighters from neighbouring Mayendit in Unity state.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Fighting ensued after SPLA/M-IO accused of setting fire to government-controlled oil installations in Pariang.  7 casualties over first 3 days of fighting.

Hundreds protested in Juba following the attack on civilians in Kworijin village. Many protesters were from the Bari community. Police accused 2 journalists of being spies, and beat and arrested the journalists.
At least 11 civilians killed over 3 days (Jan 18-20) of attacks and cattle raids on the Bari village of Kworiji-Luri, north of Juba.  Attack allegedly carried out by 50 members of the Mundari tribe.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO and government forces continued fighting after SPLA/M-IO accused of setting fire to oil installations in Pariang on Jan 19.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO and government forces continued fighting after SPLA/M-IO accused of setting fire to oil installations in Pariang on Jan 19.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled Renk on Jan. 21.
One fishermen shot dead and another injured by suspected LRA along the road between Raja to Deim Zubeir and Wau in Dangush village near Sopo area.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
NOTES: Hundreds of Dinka Bor women took to the streets in Jongeli state capital Bor, calling on the governor to resign.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: South Sudanese army forces reportedly abandoned on Friday their defence positions following sustained sustained attacks from rebels in Darkuach area (coordinates unavailable) of Unity state. Government forces were no longer in control of the area, but are still stationed within the vicinity of the Pariang oil facility.
Women from Dinka counties of Bor, Twic East and Duk protested to accuse the state's Caretaker Governor John Kong Nyuon of supporting rebels.  5 arrested.
13 people killed, including 5 journalists for South Sudan state-run media, when suspected LRA opened fire on a 2-car convoy driving through Kubri Modabal, Raja county.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Rebels shelled Bentiu.  2 killed.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked the headquarters of the government battalion in Halka (coordinates unavailable), north of Renk.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked and looted Imtidad market, northeast of Renk.
4 children and 1 woman from the Ngok Dinka tribe were killed and another reported missing in an attack on Bonj village south of Abyei.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: 280 child soldiers recruited by the South Sudan Democratic Army (SSDA) Cobra Faction led by David Yau Yau, were released in Gumuruk coordinates unavailable) in Jonglei state.

ACTOR1: REMNASA: Revolutionary Movement for National Salvation
NOTES: A new rebel movement named the Revolutionary Movement for National Salvation (REMNASA) attacked security forces in Maridi on Jan. 27.  6 soldiers killed and many wounded.  The attack marked the official launch of the rebel movement led by Lasuba Lodoru Wongon.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Military leadership arrested senior commander Col. Achuil Mathiang Kiirnaar in Juba, allegedly for failing to hold defensive positions in recent fighting with SPLA-IO in Pariang.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Military and police forces deployed in Northern Bahr al Ghazal State's capital city Aweil amid high political tension following the resolution to impeach Governor Kuel Aguer.

Rioters closed a bridge connecting Western Bahr El Ghaza to Warrap state at Tharkueng area (coordinates unavailable). Protest in response to the Kuac South Payam community of Warrap for removing the flag of Western Bahr El Ghazal which was mounted at Dong, an area the community claimed to be  inside Warrap state territory. One medical assistant shot.
5 injured in clashes in Ayenic, Awerial County between youth from Rorapuk and Kochmaboor.  3 arrested.

ACTOR2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Government forces attacked SPLA/M-IO rebel bases in Wiechok and Buoth areas near Mayom.
SPLA-Juba allegedly attacked civilians south of Mayom.

2 killed in clashes between displaced and host communities in Gendrasa camp in Maban County. Clashes began after four Blue Nile refugees killed a local farmer, prompting the farmer's family to kill a refugee in retaliation.

ACTOR2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Bentiu.
Continued clashes between displaced and host communities in Gendrasa camp in Maban County. 6 injured.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Hundreds of unidentified armed men attacked Jalle Payam in Bor County. Houses burnt, thousands of cattle stolen, and children abducted. 5 killed, 7 wounded. Army and police units were dispatched to the area the following day.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: During a second day of fighting with the army, SPLA/M-IO fired rockets into Bentiu, killing two civilians.
Cattle raiders from Pibor attacked villages of Pager and Lualdiit near Twic East.

ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei
NOTES: Misseriya tribesmen with machine guns attacked UNISFA forces in Mayankor area, 10km from Abyei. 11 arrested.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan);  WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO rebels in Jiech Payam, Ayod County detained a WFP helicopter that was bringing food to Uror and supposedly illegally landed in Jiech.  Rebels forcefully removed Chol Aruai (National Bureau of Statistics), Mading Akueth (Lutheran World Federation), and Jacob Alier (WFP), all allegedly targeted because of their Dinka ethnicity. All the abductees were released in Juba on Feb 5.
5 fishermen killed by unknown gunmen in a fishing camp in Tonj North County on Feb 3.
Clashes between Rup and Keui tribes sparked after a staff member of the State Ministry of Information was killed in his house. 6 killed.
A gunmen killed a man in Pankar village. The man was from the Amonthnhom clan of the Kuei section.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled a military camp in Rankai area in Mayom town.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled military positions in Nasir.

Clashes between Habbaniyah and Rizaygat tribes in Bahr Al Arab, after Habbaniyah tribesmen stole 57 cows and 4 camels from a Rizaygat owner.  Rizeigat then formed a team to pursue the thieves. 2 Habbaniyah men killed.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO rebel attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.
Lawyers went on a one-day strike to protest the interruption of their Bar Association elections that were to take place on Feb. 9.
Workers at Juba International Airport went on strike demanding unpaid allowances and protesting poor working conditions.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: 300 child soldiers were released from Yau Yau's rebel group in Pibor.  This is the second wave of demobilization of Yau Yau/SSDA child soldiers, following the release of 280 child soldiers on Jan 27.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO forces shelled Bentiu on Feb. 10.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO rebel attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled Malakal area on Feb. 10.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled Nasir on Feb. 10.
Clashes between Misseriya and Nuer militia in Al-Dihin area, east of Abyei, after a group of Nuer tribesmen stole Misseriya cattle. 13 killed.
Residents of Hai Sherikat in Gumbo protested after the Central Equatoria state government moved to demolish their houses. Police fired shots to disperse the crowd. Several people arrested.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.
Unknown person threw a hand grenade at a supermarket in Bor. 3 traders from Ethiopia injured.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO rebel attacked Abud area near Kaka in Manyo County Feb 9-12.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Military set fire to hospital buildings and a WFP food store in Nasir. No casulaties reported.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO fired two rockets at an army supply flight as it landed at an airstrip in Nasir.
Unknown gunmen shot three bullets into the leg of National Parliament member Joseph Ngere Paciko in Mundri West.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ALLY_ACTOR_1: SSDA: South Sudan Democratic Army; Murle Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: On Feb 12, a splinter group of the Cobra forces of Greater Pibor Area of Murle ethnic group announced its defection from government forces and declared allegiance to Machar's rebels.
Gunmen killed Anuak tribal leader Ujulu Oman in Pochalla County in Konglei.  2 children were abducted in Pochalla the same day.

Clashes between groups in Kella Payam near Torit, when women from Terongore went to fish and were shot by youth from Muratika. Youth from Muratika claimed that youths from Terongore raided their cattle.  4 people wounded.
6 Murle tribesman attacked citizens from Makuac Payam in Tibek. 1 killed and others wounded.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military Feb 16 in Kaka.  Local authorities in Manyo County refuted SPLA/M's claims that rebels overtook the area.  Several rebels killed, 10 soldiers injured.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Renk area on Feb 16. At least 14 wounded.
Johnson Olonyi's rebel group forcibly abducted hundreds of schoolboys (originally reported as at least 89 abducted) and 6 teachers that were preparing for exams in Wau Shilluk on Feb 15 and 16.

Unidientified group forcibly abducted 89 schoolboys and 6 teachers that were preparing for exams in Wau Shilluk on Feb 16 and 17. UNICEF stated that the area is controlled by Gen Olony's government-allied Shilluk militia, but had no verifiable evidence of which group committed the abductions.
A British aid worker (Carter Center) was shot dead when a gunmen followed him into his compound in Juba on Feb 17.  4 arrested.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Fashoda County on Feb 17.  SPLA/M-IO claimed to have captured Haluf near Kaka, but local Manyo authorities stated that the rebels withdrew from Haluf.  Several government soldiers killed.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M and military in Renk area on Feb 17.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Senior official of SPLA/M-IO Brig Lul Ruai Koang announced his defection from Machar's forces and the formation of his own faction with membership of the Lou-Nuer White Army. The new rebel group is known as the South Sudan Resistance Movement/Army (SSRM/A).  The main objective of the group is to establish a separate state for Greater Akobo counties of Lou Nuer.  Officials in greater Akobo counties have dismissed claims of Lou Nuer's White Army defection, stating that the whole Lou Nuer territory and forces remain under the leadership of Machar.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Kaka and Adoudi, Malut area on Feb 18.  80 soldiers injured and 50 disappeared.  6 soldiers killed.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Renk area on Feb 18.
Lecturers at the University of Juba go on strike to demand allowances that were deducted since 2012 for austerity measures.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled government-held areas of Dukduk.
Unknown gunmen killed 2 in Anyiel Village, Twic County, Warrap state (coordinates for Warrap state capital Kuajok are used). 2 arrested.

Clashes between locals, soldiers, and police after a bar owner attacked an SPLA-Juba soldier with a knife in Owiny Ki-bul.  In retaliation, soldiers beat people, looted and burned houses in the village and market.  30 wounded, 1 soldier killed.  3 soldiers injured by stray bullets fired by police.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Reports of clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Unity State.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Around 80 boys 13 to 14 years old forcibly recruited by SPLA/M-IO soldiers in Leer.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Mass recruitment of child soldiers by SPLA/M-IO in Panyijar.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Reports of clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Nasir.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Armed clashes between herders from Jonglei state and Mundari cattle keepers in Lainya County and along Yei-Juba road.  12 dead over 2 days of fighting, including a soldier who was heading to Juba.  Police forces were sent to the area.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Armed clashes between herders from Jonglei state and Mundari cattle keepers, began in Lainya County and along the Yei-Juba road.  12 dead over 2 days of fighting, including a soldier who was heading to Juba.  Police forces were sent to the area.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: More than 600 child soldiers demobilized from Yau Yau's rebel group in Pibor.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army forces in Tom South, Pariang County. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled Renk, hitting homes and a stadium in Al Sarayat neighborhood.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Hundreds of men and boys were forcibly recruited by SPLA/M-IO in Old Fangak.
More than 100 workers from the Ayat Construction Company in Western Bahr El Ghazal went on strike over unpaid salaries.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and military in Ayod County.
Cattle raiders attacked Ngap cattle camp in Rumbek. 5 killed.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO shelled government-controlled areas of Nasir.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked Bugaya area of Maban County the week of March 2. Burned a heathcare center.

ACTOR1: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei
NOTES: UN forces battled Misseriya militia near the village of Shegag, after Misseriya earlier attacked the Ngor Dinka village of Marialachak. 3 Misseriya killed. 4 children abducted, released on April 9 in Aweil following mediation between UNISFA and Misseriya.

SOURCE: Associated Press International; Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune
NOTES: 100 armed Misseriya tribesmen attacked the majority Ngok Dinka village of Marialachak on March 2. 5 killed (reported by Radio Tamazuj), 3 wounded, 8 abducted, and 24 houses burned. It is alleged that Popular Defence Forces were behind the attacks. UN forces were deployed.

Police in Wau staged a strike in protest of unpaid wages for January and February. Rioters blocked the main roads and locked several police officers in their offices and then fired gunshots in the air. Military were dispatched, leading to an exchange of fire between police and military.   4 or 5 people  killed by stray bullets.  Military began to withdraw from Wau on March 4.

Clashes between LRA and South Sudanese military in Nabiapai Boma, along the border with Democratic Republic of Congo. 1 LRA and 1 soldier killed.  Clashes took place soon after 13 people were abducted by LRA near the border.
LRA abducts 13 boys in Nabiapai Boma, near border with Democratic Republic of Congo. 9 abductees were later released soon after capture.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked military in Raja County.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO attacked military in Sere Malaga area along the border with the disputed Kafia Kinji area in Western Bahr el Ghazal. Soldiers captured 4 rebels and some weapons.

As military soldiers withdrew from Wau following riots and clashes between police and military on March 2, they beat a policeman and put him in a vehicle driving towards the military garrision. The man was later returned to Wau Civil Hospital where he died.  Police believe that 70 police personnel are being held at the military garrison in Grinti.
Government supporters demonstrated against planned UN sanctions in the country.

ACTOR1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
NOTES: Clashes between SPLA/M-IO and army in Duk Duk area of Renk.
4 teenagers died in Agok in Abyei area when a grenade they found detonated.
