SPLM-N attacked military in Alfarishaiya, 25km northwest of Dilling, taking control of the area for two hours before withdrawing. 28 soldiers killed. Rebels seized seven anti-tank launchers and 5 heavy machine guns.
Unknown gunmen attempted to steal the vehicle of a Popular Police Forces coordinator. When he protested, the gunmen shot him dead.
Hundreds of medical staff staged a sit-in at the Ministry of Health in Nyala in protest of the delay of February salaries.

Government militia attacked the villages of Jambo, Ghireiban and Turra, near Kutum.  41 killed, 7 injured,and  4 abducted over 3 days of attacks (14 fatalities coded for March 30, 14 for fatalities for March 31, and 13 fatalities for Apr. 1).
A leader of Otash camp for the displaced, east of Nyala, was killed by militiamen.
Residents of Es Sururab in west Omdurman clashed over a land dispute. 10 people injured, some taken to hospital. Police broke up the fighting.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: National Intelligence and Security Service (NISS) assaulted a number of lawyers protesting in front of the Khartoum North Criminal Court, during a trial session of opposition leaders Faroug Abu Eisa and Dr Amin Mekki Madani. The lawyers were severely beaten, taken to another location and further beaten, before being released 9 hours later.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military forces in Rashad.
7,000 displaced in Murnei camp assembled at Freedom Square near camp, protesting against the upcoming election and the government's demand for UNAMID's departure.

Government militia attacked the villages of Jambo, Ghireiban and Turra, near Kutum.  41 killed, 7 injured,and  4 abducted over 3 days of attacks (14 fatalities coded for March 30, 14 for fatalities for March 31, and 13 fatalities for Apr. 1).
Soldier raped 13-year-old girl in Tabit.
Clashes between Maaliya and Rizaygat militias in Sabah El Nima area in Abu Karinka. At least 20 killed or injured.  Army forces intervened.
Clashes between vigilate militia and unknown group attempting to steal livestock in Yassin locality. A man was shot dead and another seriously injured.
Clashes between police and unknown militia in Abyad camp in Gereida after police intrvened to stop an attack on camp residents. One policeman wounded.
150 women in Ed Daein protested against the Zakat Chamber, an Islamic alms institution, over accusations of corruption and nepotism.
Gunmen on camels shot and killed a man who tried to intervene when they assaulted two young women in Sani Efendo area of Yassin locality.
A group of militiamen on motorcycles stormed Abyad camp in Gereida and shot one man, who was taken to the hospital.

Government militia attacked the villages of Jambo, Ghireiban and Turra, near Kutum.  41 killed, 7 injured,and  4 abducted over 3 days of attacks (14 fatalities coded for March 30, 14 for fatalities for March 31, and 13 fatalities for Apr. 1).
SAF dropped 10 bombs on Rowata. 14 civilians killed, 18 wounded.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in rebel-controlled area of Jebel Ubsim, 25kms southwest of Al Abbasiyya. 8 killed.
SAF dropped 19 bombs on Rofita area of Rokerro. 5 villagers killed. 19 houses set on fire.
SAF dropped 17 bombs on Burgo area of Fanga in East Jebel Marra. One child killed.
Two pro-government militiamen on camels wearing military uniforms attacked Bakin area in Kas. Shot one men dead.
Unknown armed group abducted a man collecting firewood in Tarni.
Pro-government militiamen shot two villagers dead in Malawiya near Mellit.
Unknown gunmen killed three civilians in El Meriam, West Korofan.
RSF beat a number of people in El Meiram while robbing them of their vehicles and money. Some civilians detained.

Clashes between Misseriya and Rizaygat militia at Duraba on the border between East Darfur and West Kordofan states (coordinates for East Darfur captial Ed Daien used). 2 Rizaygat and 3 Misseriya killed on Apr 3.

Second day of clashes between Misseriya and Rizaygat militia at Duraba on the border between East Darfur and West Kordofan states (coordinates for East Darfur captial Ed Daien used). 1 Rizaygat and 4 Misseriya killed on Apr 4.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military and militias in Kanga village west of Kadugli in South Kordofan. Rebels pursued military to the outskirts of Kelak town.
SAF bombed Kroongo village in Miri Payam. 20 homes burnes, 500 households displaced.
SAF bombed Taguli. 7 killed, 4 injured.
Third day of clashes between Misseriya and Rizaygat militia at Duraba on the border between East Darfur and West Kordofan states (coordinates for East Darfur captial Ed Daien used).
Mortar shell from military garrison in Deribat killed a mother and child in East Jebel Marra.

A group of militiamen on camels beat three young women with whips and and raped a 15-year-old girl of Kassab camp while the girls were collecting firewood 5km north of the camp. Other Kassab camp residents were beat by militiamen the same day while collecting firewood southeast of the camp.

A group of former rebel combatants severely beat the South Darfur Humanitarian Aid Commissioner at the Disarmament, Demobilisation, and Reintegration Commission in Nyala, where the rioters had gathered to demand  entitlements.
SAF dropped 5 bombs on Rowata as UN verification patrol was in the area to confirm an aerial bombardment that occurred Apr. 1.
Three Janjaweed raped two women at gunpoint in Riheid See Sawa area, 20 km south of Tawila.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Abu Tira
NOTES: Border Guards supported by Abu Tira shot two men dead in Tofai village, 7km from El Kuma. 2 others were abducted.
SPLM-N ambush SAF troops in Al Abbasiya-Taqali town.
SAF bombed Al Kuk village, 9 killed.
SAF dropped cluster bombs on Dalami and Umm Durein counties in the first week of April.
Gunmen on motorcycles ambushed a passenger lorry in Abu Sufyan in Ailliet locality. 10 killed, 8 wounded.
SAF bombed Tunguli, Dalami county. 7 killed.
SPLM-N and army clash in Gissan, south of Ad-Damazin. 9 soldiers killed, including Lt. Ahmed Awad Yassin.

Anti-election protests by UPF students in Khartoum, moved from El Neelain University and passed Suq el Arabi into downtown Khartoum. Part of the Leave Campaign. Police used tear gas, batons and rubber bullets to disperse protesters. Three students detained. No serious injuries reported.
SPLM-N claim to destroy a military camp in El Dabkar. 4 soldiers killed.
Anti-election protests by students in Amri, Northern State. More than 80 students detained. No injuries reported.
Clashes between unknown gunmen and private security patrol in Al-Wihad neighborhood of Nyala. One civilian killed by a stray bullet.
2 killed when an unexploded grenade deonated south of Fanga, East Jebel Marra.
Clashes between security patrol forces and militiamen during an attempted robbery in Nyala's El Wihda district. One civilian killed by a stray bullet.
Arab Ba'ath Socialist Party members protested upcoming elections in Khartoum. 2 members detained.
SPLM-N in Land Cruisers attacked Debkar village in West Kordofan. 2 killed, several wounded. Rebels looted and burned the local market.
Government-backed militia shot and killed a man on a motorcycle in Tunde area, east of Foro Burunga.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur
NOTES: Three militamen intercepted a UNAMID vehicle in Nyala, ordered the passengers to disembark at gunpoint, and abducted the driver. He was released later that day.
SPLM-N shot down an SAF drone in Um Sardabah in the Nuba Mountains.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: Clashes between RSF and unidentified armed group in Ab Kadma in al-Dambaloya area, West Kurdufan. 5 killed.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: SPLM-Peace: Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement (Peace Faction)
SOURCE: Sudan Tribune; African Centre for Justice and Peace Studies
NOTES: SPLM Peace Wing activist abducted from his home in El Roseires by unidentified group.
Residents of Hamidiya camp protested against presidential elections and the relection of al-Bashir.
Residents of ten camps near Kabkabiya in North Darfur protested against presidential elections and the relection of al-Bashir.
Residents of Kalma camp protested against presidential elections and the relection of al-Bashir.
Residents of Murnei camp protested against presidential elections and the reelction of al-Bashir.
Residents of seven camps near Zalingei in Central Darfur - including Hassa Hissa and Khamsa Dagiag camps - protested against presidential elections and the reelction of al-Bashir.
Janjaweed raped a woman from Fallujah village in East Jebel Marra as she was collecting firewood.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS detained Sudanese Congress Party activists in El Suki, near Sinja, on the eve of presidential elections.

Several hundred students from Red Sea University in Port Sudan protested in the town center against presidential elections and demanding the arrest of al-Bashir. Police used batons to disperse protesters. No reports of serious injuries.

SOURCE: Sudan Tribune; African Centre for Justice and Peace Studies
NOTES: Anti-election protests in front of Al Neelain University in Khartoum. Several students arrested.
National Umma Party staged an anti-election sit-in at its headquarters in Omdurman.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
SOURCE: Sudan Tribune; African Centre for Justice and Peace Studies
NOTES: NISS detained Nuba ethnic individual on suspicion of being SPLM-N-affiliated. They were held for three days, beaten with water pipes, and  released on the street blindfolded.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
ALLY_ACTOR_2: National Umma Party; SLM/A: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army
NOTES: Umma Party activist was forcibly taken from her car by suspected NISS agents in Omdurman. Farouk was released on April 15, after having been severely beaten while in detention. NISS also abducted another SLM member from her home in Omdurman.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS detained Sudanese Congress Party members in Ed Duweim, on the eve of presidential elections.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS detained activists in El Roseires on the first day of elections.
SPLM-N shelled Tumat on the first day of presidential elections. Two babies injured.
Anti-election protests in Ronga Tas camp in Azum locality.
Anti-election protests in Bindisi camp.
For a second day, residents of Hamidiya camp protested against presidential elections and the reelction of al-Bashir.
For second day, residents of seven camps near Zalingei in Central Darfur - including Hassa Hissa and Khamsa Dagiag camps - protested against presidential elections and the relection of al-Bashir.
Janjaweed attacked the market of El Salam camp, east of Kabkabia. They beat and whipped merchants and fired bullets at passing vehicles.
Thousands of displaced from Murnei camp protested elections in Freedom Square at the center of Murnei.  Police and militia in vehicles injured 5 protesters with bullet wounds.
SPLM-N attacked polling stations in Abbasiya.  Attacks repelled by military.
SPLM-N attacked polling stations in Habila. Attacks repelled by military. No casualties reported. Polling stations closed.
SPLM-N shelled El Rahmania on the first day of presidential elections.
SPLM-N reported to have kidnapped civilians in South Kordofan the week of presidential elections.
Two herders lost their legs stepping on a hand grenade in Umm Dukhun.
Anti-election protests in Ronga Tas camp in Azum locality.
Anti-election protests in Kabkabiya camps.
Anti-election protests in Kalma camp.

Clashes between prison guards and escaping prisoners in Zalingei. Prisoners seized Dushka machine guns and fled to the forest north of Zalingei, where clashes continued. Unknown number of inmates, policemen and civilians killed and wounded.

Anti-election demonstration on at campus at El Fasher University.  Police and NCP student members used batons, tear gas and live bullets to stop 200 student protesters from entering the city center. 2 women students wounded and 12 detained and taken to an unknown location.
Continuing clashes between SPLM-N and military in Al Abbasiya.
SPLM-N fired 3 missiles at Delling town, injuring two children.
SPLM-N fired 4 missiles at polling stations in Kadugli. 2 women killed.
A landmine exploded along Dilling-Kadugli road, killing at least 3 people and wounding 3 others.
A group of women abducted a man securing a polling station in Dabri.

Following a rape of a Sese camp resident, a group of camp residents stabbed two militiamen responsible for the rape. The militiamen burned two houses in the camp later that evening. Militiamen returned to the camp the following day to demand compensation for the injuries.
SAF bomb Fanga. No casualties reported.
Anti-election protests at the University of El Fasher for second day in a row. Police dispersed crowds with tear gas.
Militiamen raped a woman near Sese camp in Kereinik locality.

Student protests when Red Sea state transported policemen, fire fighters, and prison guards to cast ballots in Deim Arab. Protesters tried to prevent police from entering the district, on the grounds that their names were not listed in the election records, but the forces cordoned off the streets and used tear gas to reach the polling centre.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: Dozens of activists gathered in front of the Human Rights Commission demanding the release of Sandra Farouk Kadouda, an activist detained since April 12 by suspected NISS agents. NISS forces got into fist-fights with protesters. No reports of serious injuries.
SPLM-N launched missile attacks on Kadugli and Delling, killing 4 civilians and injuring 9 others (2 fatalities coded for Kadugli, 2 fatalies for Delling).
SPLM-N launched missile attacks on Kadugli and Delling, killing 4 civilians and injuring 9 others (2 fatalities coded for Kadugli, 2 fatalies for Delling).
Military shelled SPLM-N in Chururu, 5km from Kadugli. 3 civilians killed, 5 injured.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Two polling stations in Al-Sheriff were under fire by an armed group. No casualties reported.
Pro-government militia abduct a man in Kutum.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Military Intelligence Service
NOTES: Military intelligence detained a displaced man at Sirba bus station and beat him severely, shaving his head with glass shards.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: Human rights activists arrested by NISS in Khartoum.
3 SAF soldiers killed in SPLM-N bombing of an unidentified camp in South Kordofan.
SAF warplane bombed rebel-held Tanpona areas in Kurmuk county.  1 civilian killed, 5 wounded. SPLM-N forces responded by targeting NCP forces and miitia positions.
Clashes between gunmen and police in al-Jeer neighborhood of Nyala. 1 civilian hit and killed by a stray bullet.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Abu Tira
NOTES: Sudanese Popular Liberation Front attacked Abu Tira in Dafra oil field near Heglig. 31 policeman reportedly killed. One gunmen killed. Two policeman captured.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: SAF recruits child soldiers in Altadon.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: SAF recruits child soldiers in Zarafa
Pro-government militia attacked 13 displaced women 10km north of Kabkabia, lashing and beating them with whips. One women is in a coma.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: SAF recruits child soldiers in Balulah.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS and pro-government students abducted and beat a Khartoum University student leader at NISS offices near the Shendi bus station in Khartoum.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: SAF recruits child soldiers in Wakara.

Armed group opened fire on a vehicle belonging to the Ministry of Health in Bergi area, along Deleig-Zalingei road. 3 passengers seriously wounded. Vehicle guards exchanged fire with the attackers and killed one of the gunmen.
Pro-government militia shot and wounded a displaced man near Kendebe, near Sirba camps in West Darfur
Militiamen rape a girl near Katur village in Tawila locality.
Pro-government militia opened fire on an emergency night patrol in Nyala, wounding one passenger.
Unknown group killed an IDP as he was collecting firewood 7km west of Gereida.
A number of displaced of Shangil Tobaya camp were beaten, whipped and robbed by armed herders and other gunmen.
Three government-backed militia opened fire and injured on students near El Salam camp.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: NISS allegedly beat up a student in Omdurman's Wad Nubawi district.
Unknown gunmen shot and killed the Minister of Finance in Nyala.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services; NCP: National Congress Party
NOTES: Dozens of students wounded and detained by police, security agents, and NCP student members, in Khartoum when they staged a demonstration against alleged NISS torture of a fellow student. Protesters were beat with batons and hoses. Tear gas used to disperse the crowd.
Bomb explosion kills one boy in Nuba Mountains, Southern Kurudfan.
Hundreds protested in Lagawa against the detention of three members of the Youth for Lagawa.
SPLM-N ambushed a military convoy between Madiem and Maqanza, killing 3 soldiers.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Abu Tira
NOTES: Militiamen stabbed an Abu Tira soldier to death in El Fasher.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur
NOTES: UNAMID worker from Ethiopia injured and killed in Mujkar, West Darfur.
Militiamen shot and injured a man in El Safa district in Kabkabia.
Joint Sudanese-Chadian border forces stationed at Bir Saliba detain and torture 5 residents of the Sirba camps for 3 days.
Committee of Solidarity held a sit-in at the National Human Rights Commission in Khartoum, demanding the release of 42 political detainees.
Clashes between SPLM-N and military in Kalgo, Bau county, Blue Nile State. 18 soldiers killed, 1 rebel killed.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur
NOTES: Clashes between UNAMID troops and 40 Zaghawa militia attempting to steal cattle and vehicles on the road between Kass and Shangita, 86km west of Nyala. 5 killed.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur
NOTES: Protests at UNAMID base in Kass, protesting against clashes between UNAMID and Zaghawa militia occurring earlier in the day.  Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on the protesters, killing one.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur
NOTES: UNAMID patrol travelling from Nyala attacked by gunmen near Kas. 4 peacekeepers injured.
RSF shelled a well 1.5km north of Fanga. 3 killed.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur
NOTES: A second day of protests at UNAMID base in Kass.  Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on protesters, killing a second protester.
Masked men attack a journalist and publisher of al-Mustaqilla newspaper at his house in Khartoum, following publication of columns criticizing White Nile state government.
Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF, and took control of Buram in South Darfur. 63 soldiers wounded. Unknown number killed.
Shopkeepers closed shops in protest of growing insecurity in Al Fasher.
Militiamen opened fire at the Naivasha Market in Abu Shouk camp near Al Fasher. 4 injured.
SPLM-N recaptures Kululu Hills in South Kordofan. 15 soldiers killed. 2 rebels injured.
Clashes between a group of cattle rustlers and a vigilante militia in area north of Abu Dungul and Keleikeli Abu Salama, in Abu Karaynka locality, 8 killed.
Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Dimsu.
Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Nakhara and Antakina. Exact number of fatalities unreported.

Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Tullus. JEM claim to have destroyed a military camp in the area between Nyala and Tullus, forcing military troops to flee towards Tullus. Dozens of soldiers killed including an RSF commander.
16 killed, 11 injured in SAF air strikes in El Tomat, 50km south of Tullus.
RSF run over and kill a boy in Umm Haleeb camp, firing heavily into the air as the convoy passed.
SCP members held gatherings at El Kalakla Laffa and Bahri bus station in Khartoum to demand the release of political detainees. Some arrested.

Dozens of students at the University of Bakhtalruda held a sit-in on campus to protest the study environment. Police and security raided the campus and used tear gas and batons to disperse the students. Dozens detained.
Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Dimsu for second day.
Clashes between police and suspected Maaliya militia in Al Fado, 35km north of Ad Daein, after militia raided cattle from a Rizaygat tribe.  2 police killed, 8 civilians injured.
Joint SLM/A-Minawi faction and JEM clashed with military and RSF in Nakhara region for second day.
Gunmen torched the market in Haraza in Katila locality.  One villager injured.  PDF offices were of the buildings burned.
JEM clashes with military and destroy camp in Ghubaysh locality near the border with North Darfur. Several government forces killed, 38 vehicles captures.
Dozens of students staged a sit-in at the market of El Obeid in protest of re-election of al-Bashir.  Some students detained.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Abu Tira
NOTES: 3 bombs dropped near El Malha, one detonated, destroying property in Central Reserve Police (Abu Tira) ammunition store.
A man in Turbo was killed by unexploded ordance.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Abu Tira
NOTES: At least 16 killed - including 2 Abu Tira troops - and injured in clashes between Rizaygat and Maaliya militia in Abu Karaynka.
Clashes between NCP students and Darfuri students that were criticising the government, at Sharq al-Nil University College in Khartoum. 1 died, several injured.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: Security agents aducted two students near Kalma camp.
Pro-government militia abducted three men near Omi, near Nierteti.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Banyankole Ethnic Group (Uganda); Banyarwanda Ethnic Group (Uganda)
NOTES: Indigenous community members attack pastoralist communities. Six children and three women were injured.

More than 70 houses were burnt and several people injured when Bunyoro Kingdom loyalists attack the inhabitants of Kaseeta Parish, Kabwooya Sub-county in Hoima, over the control of a seven square mile piece of land bordering the proposed refinery area. The inhabitants are reportedly Congolese.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Attackers suspected to have come from Amuru District invade the Adjumani area and burn more than 17 houses to ashes and loot 27 animals. The area is contested between residents of the two the communities.
Police break into a mosque and evict protesters who occupied the building in a demonstration against the mosque 's current clerical leadership.

Unidentified assailants attack Sheikh Haruna Jjemba. The assailants exchange fire with Jjemba's bodyguard before withdrawing. The attack comes in the aftermath of a string of attacks on notable Muslim figures. Official sources blame the ADF while other sources other sources attribute the murders to long-running disputes between rival Muslim factions over property and leadership. No body was killed in the battle.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Military police surround the residence of ex-general Sejusa in a bid to arrest him. Sejusa recently returned after going into exile for allegedly revealing that Museveni is organising for his son to succeed him.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Rwandan genocide suspect Jean Paul Birindabagabo  is arrested and extridited to the ICC.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NAU: National Association of the Unemployed
NOTES: Activist youth group - National Association of the Unemployed - demonstrates in Kampala .

SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House (Toronto)
NOTES: A journalist covering a demonstration by an activist youth group - National Association of the Unemployed - in Kampala is detained and severely beaten into a coma by the police.

SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House (Toronto)
NOTES: Journalists march to Naguru police station to protest against the beating of a journalist by a member of the police forces. They are intercepted by police and dispersed with pepper spray.
Clan militias clash over access to hunting grounds. A resident dies during the clashes.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Banyankole Ethnic Group (Uganda); Banyarwanda Ethnic Group (Uganda)
NOTES: Indigenous community member kill a pastoralist. The pastoralist was accused of grazing his animals on the cultivator's crops.

UNATU announces a nationwide strike over government's failure to remit the shs10b earlier pledged by President Museveni to reinforce the financial clout of teachers' savings groups. The strike is put on hold the following day due to negotiations with the government.

A group of about 30 men with clubs attack two journalists leaving both of them hospitalised. The journalists had recently published pieces alleging that the Tooro Royal family had been acquiring land illegally.  The police reportedly refused to investigate the assault.
National Resistance Movement publicity secretary for Namayingo district, Mr David Tito Okware, is shot dead by unknown assassins.

NRM members occupy the office of Lira Resident District Commissioner, complaining that their names had been erased from a list of beneficiaries of shs 200 million pledged to 65 party loyalists from Lango by Museveni.
Clans in Kitgum clash, leaving 24 homesteads burnt and 24 cows stolen. The violence stemmed from the death of a child.
Students strike over the university's policy of 100% payment of tuition within the first six weeks of the semester.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: 34 suspected ADF rebels are arrested.
Two suspected cattle thieves are killed by residents
Police fire teargas at rioting students. The students were demonstrating over the university's policy of 100% payment of tuition within the first six weeks of the semester.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Unidentified assailants burn down camps and properties belonging to Salaf Muslims

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Unidentified assailants burn down camps and properties belonging to Salaf Muslims
Cultivators and pastoralists clash over land. The cultivators accuse the pastoralists of letting their animals wreck the local agriculture.
A bomb blast injures two inmates of Gulu central prison. The identity of planters is unknown.
13 youths allied to ex-Prime Minister Amama Mbabazi protest outside the US embassy and are arrested by police.

The chief prosecutor probing the 2010 twin bombings that killed 76 people in Kampala is shot dead by an unidentified group. Sources differ over whether the killing was carried out by a terrorist or primarily criminal group.
Makerere University Muslim students stage a peaceful demonstration and demand that police renounces allegations labelled against Muslim theological and Koran schools (Madrasas) as terror cells.
UPDF and police violently evict civilians from a contested plot of land, leading to multiple serious injuries.
A man accussed of murdering an associated during a drunken argument is killed by residents.
A resident of Mwizi sub county Rwampara county Mbarara district is killed by angry residents when they found him slaughtering a stolen goat.
An officer attached to the Uganda People's Defense Forces has been shot dead by suspected Pian warriors in Nakapiripirit District
Students protest against poor quality meals and alleged torture by their teachers. The students destroy school property prompting the police to respond.
Students protest against poor quality meals and alleged torture by their teachers. The students destroy school property prompting the police to respond.
Students beat a suspected thief to death.
Students at Bukalasa Agricultural College protest against the college's policy of charging late-registration fees. Police fire live ammo in the air to disperse the rioters.

A group of women strip naked before two government ministers and hundreds of people in Apaa village in Pabbo Sub County in Amuru and protest against a planned demarcation of a disputed boundary between Amuru and Adjumani district
Naked protesters in Apaa demonstrate in front of Internal Affairs minister Aronda Nyakirima and Lands minister Daudi Migereko. Ownership of Apaa is currently contested by  both Amuru and Adjumani
